intro: Scleranthus rochelii, commonly known as the Rochel's thornweed, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible roots. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands, roadsides, and wastelands. Its small, pinkish flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Scleranthus rochelii is characterized by its rigid, spiny stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
